author: sky.cactus
content: I forgot to bring it up in the meeting, but we really should make a decision on https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3550

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm on the fence these days.  On the one hand, I dislike any EIP talking about legal stuff at all.  On the other hand, I don't think EIP editors should be in charge of deciding what legal related statements are correct/incorrect or even what is considered a "legal claim" or reference.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think the question we should ask is, "would we merge a PR that had an incorrect legal/trademark claim?"  If the answer is yes, because editors don't review EIPs for accuracy, then we should merge this.

author: sky.cactus
content: If the answer is no, then we need to figure out what criteria we are using to decide whether a claim in an EIP is true or whether a claim is one that shouldn't be included in any EIP.

author: timbeiko
content: I just pinged the EF legal team again, but I think it may be worth assuming they will not want to publicly comment now? I don't have any better view into it, sorry

author: timbeiko
content: So, I'm mildly against moving to Last Call with unsubstantiated legal claims. IMO it's fine to have as a draft, but if it is "Final" then you want to be sure the content is accurate. I feel like it should probably fall on the champion, and not EIP editors, though, to figure out a way to get resolution there.

author: sky.cactus
content: The champion says it is accurate.  ðŸ˜„

author: timbeiko
content: It's different from, say, math, where anyone can replicate the work.

author: sky.cactus
content: To be fair to the author, they just say "you may need to read details about the trademark".

author: timbeiko
content: Merge call now, but I can look after ðŸ™‚

author: sky.cactus
content: Though, I think the specific claims I care less about and I'm more interested in setting a proper precedence.  Should editors be blocking EIPs that have "wrong" content of any kind?  Should we allow people to push EIPs through the process that are clear, but incorrect?

author: sky.cactus
content: The alternative I worry could lead to a lot of work for editors.
